definition: lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means
thousand

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
surname Fang
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
surname Bai
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: We should open all possible avenues and try all possible means to settle problems that arise.
sentences.chinese: 要廣開門路，多想辦法，千方百計，解決問題。

sentences.english: Consequently, we work hard at the task of saving time. (Unit 1-A, Book II)
sentences.chinese: 因此我們千方百計地節約時間。

sentences.english: Lest I should not prize you, you elude me in a thousand ways.
sentences.chinese: 只恐我不夠珍惜你，你千方百計地逃避。

sentences.english: They left no stone unturned in their search for the child's mother.
sentences.chinese: 他們千方百計尋找孩子的母親。

sentences.english: They tried every possible means to refloat the grounded ship.
sentences.chinese: 他們千方百計使這艘擱淺的船再漂浮起來。

sentences.english: We'll leave no stone unturned to accomplish the great task.
sentences.chinese: 爲了完成這一件偉大的任務，我們將會千方百計。

sentences.english: I have always tried my best to keep fit for my work.
sentences.chinese: 爲了我的工作，我總是千方百計地保持健康。

sentences.english: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well.
sentences.chinese: 他們千方百計僱用那些性格上天生適合服務顧客的人。

sentences.english: He wriggled into acquaintance with her.
I will study to satisfy your needs.
sentences.chinese: 我將千方百計滿足你的需求。

sentences.english: I tried to acquire the information I needed.
sentences.chinese: 我千方百計地搞到了我所需要的資料。

sentences.english: A few guests envy his honor, leave no stone unturned debases his contribution.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個客人妒忌他的榮譽，千方百計貶低他的功績。
你會千方百計尋求關注嗎？

sentences.english: We must reform the political abuses by every possible means.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須千方百計地煞住政治上的不正之風。

sentences.english: I shall leave no stone unturned to protect myself, to put as good a face on this matter as I can.
sentences.chinese: 我要千方百計地保護自己，把這事情盡力掩蓋過去。

sentences.english: Some people go to great lengths to make their homes attractive.
sentences.chinese: 有些人千方百計使他們的家令人欽羨。

definition: to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to try/to make an attempt/to think of a way (to accomplish sth)
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to have one's wish fulfilled
to plunder/to pillage/to forcibly take
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to be determined to/to insist on
extremely difficult/even more difficult
actual situation/truth
to attempt/to try/attempt/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to rack one's brains
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
